comments.body: They are just adding pathfinding to the striders so they don't leave the lava as often. In the nether, it's incredibly hot. I don't think you need a scarf when you live in the underworld.
Yes they should because then they will be faster on land as well as lava
Yes it breaks my heart to see a cold strider
Maybe only moss carpet, since it is fireproof.
Maybe only if the damage was from a player. Mobs can hit each other and take fall damage too
then your world would have to many mobs
what about the mobs that regenerate that heath then would they despawn
You’d have to distinguish different causes of damage and make rules for those, plus if mobs never despawned it would sooner or later start hogging system resources causing lag an low frame rates.
Good idea but i think it might be better if they use a crossbow

I believe that there should be no weapons. They immediately rise from one of the professions. Farmers - plow the land, helping to rise other undead; weaponisters, fletchers and armorers supply the undead with equipment; Cleric - imposes effects with potions; And so on.
They are still pacifists.
They should hunt rabbits the way wolves hunt sheep, and occasionally players would find a dropped rabbit meat in the desert from sand cat kills.
Good idea maybe if a villager sees a cow lying down they will be warned that it’ll rain and they’ll go inside.
well if it your talking about bedrock I do not know but if you are java no it shod be harder it's way to easy.

I spawned the wither on a realm with my friend. We started out with full netherite and both died. As the wither kept destroying terrain, it got to the point where i was frozen and couldnt move because of the massive lag it was creating.
allow mob griefing to be off without disabling achivements
or at least nerf the withers atk speed

The problem with the Wither in Bedrock is that Shields don't protect the Wither Skulls projectile and that Protection enchantment doesn't affect Magic Damage like it does in Java, that's why the Wither fight in BE is much more difficult then it should
It can kill you in one shot of the wither effect
I fully agree! Another bad part of fighting him is the lag caused by the dropped blocks that were broken by him.
waaa waaaa
This is great! We need more fantasy creatures! maybe the dens generate deep within mountains.
It's not really giant if it is mini though.

Since 1.16 has dropped my server has barely seen any overworld mobs spawn at all. On hard mode. The creeper farm has stopped producing ANYTHING. Traveling hundreds of blocks makes no difference. Nether spawns are fine, personal worlds are fine.
Hgggh

The despawning radius has been fitted to match up with the stimulation distance (4) issue; (In which mobs would spawn within the 44 - 45 block radius, and instantly despawn.) This new 'fix' is practically band-aided on! The transforming of villagers, breeding of open livestock, and the capture of mobs has been made nearly impossible! Mob farms have become  extreme hurdles to design. This was a poorly designed fix that needs to be addressed. Java parity of 128 block radius despawning would be highly appreciated and provide a much easier solution to troubles caused by the Bedrock 1.16 update. 

 

Please Mojang! Let our voices be heard!!!!
I think you should talk more in depth about your idea like how does it look, where does it spawn, etc.. These things could help you get more votes.
Perhaps it could spawn upside-down on the nether roof, much like the Glowstone veins? This post has a lot of potential, it just needs to go more in-depth.
I meant curls not itches
minecraft needs more cute mobs so add the pug.
they could have armor similar to ravagers just made out of gold
A giant powerful warthog.
Great Idea
Are the souls like possessing the bat because thats so creepy...
Spiders are weak because they are fast. Bane of Arthropoda is a lower level enchantment. Using it to deal more damage to creepers seems to make them somewhat obsolete.

Would be great that this enchantment could work on both the Creeper and the Endermen. Just remove bees from the list and i would rename it as "Bane of Aberrations". That way, this enchantment would no longer be worthless.
Thank you! I saw this on memes! I was gonna create a post for it! Thank you!
Perhaps phantoms could be moved from undead to aberrations as well.
This is an amazing idea and it looks great if this doesn't appear in the game sometime soon I will be very surprised

The soul creeper could be awesome, when it explodes, it could send up a blue cloud of smoke, and it could send out netherite scraps flying in all directions (just like shrapnel), and it could be a new way to get netherite scraps in Survival Mode, if you survive! And if you use shears on it, it will turn into a normal creeper, and drop soul sand or soul soil, and can drop gunpowder, netherite scrap, and soul sand or soul soil. And RedKnight404, if you're reading this comment, the soul of the creeper could go around and tell ghasts and skeletons that you're in the area and bring them to your location (if you are still in the soul sand valley by then)!
I think the Soul Creeper should have its own unique texture, rather than that of Soul Sand or Soul Soil. Other than that, I think this is an absolutely incredible idea!
They should be called Soulmites
Sorry its just not that useful of a mob, it really doesnt spice up the game

387873913852 

I was thinking about about making them drop magmascales, or something like that. Im not sure what they would do though, i didnt hae enough time to think about it. Maybe to make, blast resistance potions? Thanks to everyone who comments, im glad you are giving feedback and criticisms. I also couldn't link the reddit post because i couldn't post it as i didn't have enough comment karma but i will post it eventually.
Maybe magma grubs.

I don't think sheep should stop dropping wool completely. It can be made so that the dropping rate reduce as difficulty goes on. Otherwish, I can't see why sheep shouldn't drop wool as new players may find it frustrating to find iron, especcially with unfavorable natural spawn locations.
I really like this idea. It'll help to bring more balance into the early game. It'll incentivize the kind of grisly early game I miss from Minecraft.
Cela empêcherait aux nouveaux joueurs de ce faire un lit rapidement. Je ne suis pas d'accord.
No offense I kinda just hate this idea with a passion.
Newbies would hate this.
Yeah, this is great. Either find a village/igloo, or suffer the first night properly.

I agree, it would indirectly make beds a reward for either getting 2 iron or killing a bunch of spiders. The way it is now, you basically get it for free. This would make crafting a bed more accomplishing and satisfying, and would be more proportionate to how OP they are.
Dodo they turn into Husk when they leave the Nether. And do any zombies turn into them when they are in the Nether?
I'm always for more mobs in Nether!
The ghoul? My name for it when I thought about it was the scorched
I like this idea its creative

Add on hard/normal only though. I love this idea. It might be annoying, for those wanting casual play. For that it should have a major weakness, or some way to deter it. However, it should have something usefull it does, some special loot, for example. I am imagining this going well with a new ore, or cave update....

388126405172 its major weaknesses are torches and pickaxes, because it gets revealed when exposed to light, so you can avoid it, and if you accidentally  mine it thinking it is an ore, you can easily mine it again to kill it. I don't think it should have something useful it does, but instead would simply just provide a challenge to caves, like how zombies don't really provide anything useful. But the Sedurt could have a rare chance of dropping the ore its disguised as.

Also, this would allow beating the game without finding Nether fortresses, which can take a ridiculously long time to find. It's pretty much the main, if not only reason I've never beaten the game legit. Fully support.

This.

Though I think making it a rare drop would keep the value of finding a blaze spawner to balance it out, since not every player will be in playing in peaceful mode. This will be the only way to obtain a blaze rod without having to change difficulty from peaceful to anything else.
Only in peaceful mode

I had no idea that it was in a mod... I've always played on PS4, and a short amount of time on xbox360. We don't have mods on PS4 unfortunately.
I have Ice&Fire mod 1.16.5 and I accidentally put mine on patrol and I've never seen it again... Idk how to get it back or where to start looking for it. Note to future self: DO NOT PUT IT ON PATROL

I could vote on this but I'd really like to see them become a tameable pet like they are in the Ice and and Fire mod. We have tons of mobs already,  we don't have enough powerful pets. Dogs are sketchy and die easy. I haven't played vanilla Minecraft in a while because it doesn't have cockatrices and I fell in love with them in Ice and Fire. Going to vanilla Minecraft where there's nothing but a dog that gets killed very easily is hard when you've got a faithful cockatrice. I also like the suggestions for the introduction of this entity as a mob into the game but would just like to see it also something that can be tamed very similar to Ice and Fire if not I identical.

I don't like the suggestion that chickens will attack cockatrices though; it should be the opposite because they are related. I don't like the idea of their health points being very low either because they're in that category of creatures that are powerful and deadly. Not something that can be pecked to death by its cousin, lol.
Ghasts are already like 5 by 5 blocks, maybe a smaller variant would be good?
Maybe a Ghast that breaks into smaller Ghasts like Slimes.
Or maybe it instead of firing fire balls it would make mini ghast that are hard to hit
Making it smaller would be more challenging because smaller targets would be harder to hit
It should be rare too
